parameters.definition: Maximum number of regular models demanded per day
Maximum number of premium models demanded per day
Maximum number of total cars that can be made per day

description: A car manufacturer makes two versions of the same car, a regular model and a premium model. They make x1 regular models per day and x2 premium models per day. The profit per regular model is \param{ProfitRegular} and the profit per premium model is \param{ProfitPremium} (x1 and x2 are unknown values both greater than or equal to 0). The daily demand for these cars is limited to at most \param{MaxDemandRegular} regular models and \param{MaxDemandPremium} premium models. In addition, the manufacturer can make a maximum of \param{MaxTotal} cars of either type per day. How many cars of each model should the manufacturer make in order to maximize profit?
